function signature: number of function arguments (all functions must take a different number of arguments)
length of function arguments (all arguments must be of different length)
expressions: literal values used in the expression
names of the operands (variables used in the expression)
operators: different logical or arithmetic operators, depending on what the example uses
collections: type of a collection data structure used (list/tuple/dictionary)
types: type name used in a type annotation
exceptions: type of an exception thrown (rewrite the code in the expression blocks accordingly)
statement: type of a control flow statement (if/while)
